result.execSummary:
The defendant Nathan Earl Mayfield was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Carry Concealed Weapon, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.23(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges of this case, including any applicable mandatory surcharges and supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections. Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
Court finds the defendant eligible for expungement following the successful completion of probation.

Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment including random urine screens.
Maintain absolute sobriety, if recommended.

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt:
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  Defendant sentenced to serve 4 months in the House of Correction STRAIGHT TIME with credit for zero days time served.  COURT STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed the defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 1 year.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
-Successfully complete a parenting class.
-Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment including random urine screens.
-Maintain absolute sobriety, if recommended.
-Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges of this case, including any applicable mandatory surcharges and supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections. Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
-Defendant to pay all supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.
-Maintain full time employment.
-Complete 25 hours of community service.
-No firearms or weapons.
Court finds the defendant eligible for expungement following the successful completion of probation.
Received and filed: Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief.

Defendant Nathan Earl Mayfield in court with attorney Lynn Ellen Hackbarth.  Daniel J. Gabler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty. Judgment of conviction entered.

Defendant Nathan Earl Mayfield in court.  Joy Hammond appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Attorney Hackbarth is not available due to a medical appointment.  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 24.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 21, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Nathan Earl Mayfield in court.  Daniel J. Gabler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  JUDGE BOROWSKI, BRANCH 12 FOR JUDGE PROTASIEWICZ, BRANCH 24.    Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 24.  Stipulated request for adjournment received and filed.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 24, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Nathan Earl Mayfield in court with attorney Lynn Ellen Hackbarth.  Daniel J. Gabler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Defense counsel requested an adjournment to discuss a possible DPA.  Court ordered case adjourned for pretrial conference in Branch 24.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 16, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Order appointing counsel at county expense signed and filed.  Copy of Order and Complaint mailed to Attorney Hackbarth.

Defendant Nathan Earl Mayfield in court.  Daniel J. Gabler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court finds defendant qualifies for representation at county expense.  Court appoints Attorney Lynn Hackbarth.  Telephone call to Attorney Hackbarth who accepts appointment.   Court finds defendant has the ability to repay the County at the rate of $50.00 per month upon conclusion of case.  Matter scheduled for Pretrial.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 18, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Court ordered ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY, and not to be in possession of any firearms or weapons.

Defendant Nathan Earl Mayfield in court.  Katherine Halopka-Ivery appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    
Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Protasiewicz, Branch 24. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.   Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel. Defendant does not qualify for Public Defender representation.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance.  Case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Branch 24.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 5, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Nathan Earl Mayfield
Current: 5301 North Teutonia Avenue, Apt. 210, Milwaukee, WI 53209   (Effective: 04-28-2015)
Prior: 5301 North Teutonia Avenue #210, Milwaukee, WI 53209
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 04-28-2015 at 01:30pm
